poem:
"Beneath the Interest's Weight"

Beneath urgency's weight, commerce breathes,
Sprouting 272,000 verdant leaves.
Bears and bulls in play, 
Economists barking in sleep, watch May,
Outpace their dreams, their estimates.
April's gains, mere silhouettes,
On the Wall Street's broad, sunlit face.
Unemployment's shadow lays frail trace.
A fertile tale of interest rates,
So the labor market narrates.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US adds 272,000 jobs as labor market holds unexpectedly strong amid high interest rates The US economy added 272,000 jobs in May, a sign the labor market continued strong amid high interest rates, the Bureau of Labor Statistics announced on Friday. The number of May jobs was far higher than the 190,000 economists had expected and topped April’s gains, when a revised 165,000 jobs were added to the economy. The unemployment rate rose to 4%". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: US adds 272,000 jobs as labor market holds unexpectedly strong amid high interest rates The US economy added 272,000 jobs in May, a sign the labor market continued strong amid high interest rates, the Bureau of Labor Statistics announced on Friday.
